data.title: Building Automation Controls Systems Reviews: Alerton
data.meta_description: We continue reviewing the best building automation controls systems in 2023 by looking at Alernon Controls. In previous posts, we reviewed Delta Controls and Automated Logic. In this post we will review the history of Alerton Controls, the solutions, products, and reviews as we take a deep look at Alerton as a building automation control system.
data.text:
About:

Alerton Controls is a leading provider of Building Automation Control Systems, specializing in HVAC controls and energy management solutions. With its extensive range of products and integrated systems, Alerton has become a trusted name in the industry.

Whether you want to improve your building’s HVAC system or increase energy efficiency, Alerton Controls has you covered. One of their key strengths is their expertise in Building Automation Controls.

They understand that each building is unique and has different needs for managing systems like lighting, temperature control, and security. Their innovative solutions allow for seamless integration of these components, resulting in an efficient and user-friendly building management system.

Alerton Controls is committed to using BACnet systems, an industry-standard protocol for building automation, which enables communication between devices from different manufacturers.

By implementing BACnet systems, Alerton ensures compatibility with a wide range of equipment, allowing users to choose the best products for their needs.

From advanced sensors for monitoring indoor air quality to intuitive user interfaces for easy system management, Alerton’s product line is impressive. They also offer potent controllers with built-in algorithms for optimizing energy usage. Whether you need a comprehensive solution for a large commercial building or a simple system upgrade for a smaller facility, Alerton has tailored options.

In addition to its extensive product offerings and innovative solutions, Alerton Controls has received positive customer reviews in various industries. Customers appreciate their systems’ reliability and ease of use and the exceptional customer support provided by their knowledgeable staff.

Customers have noticed significant improvements in energy efficiency after implementing Alerton’s controls. If you’re looking for top-notch Building Automation Control Systems that seamlessly integrate various components and provide energy-efficient solutions, Alerton Controls is the trusted choice.

Their commitment to BACnet systems, extensive product offerings, and positive customer reviews make them the go-to option for building management needs. Whether you need to optimize your HVAC controls or enhance your energy management capabilities, Alerton Controls has the expertise and solutions to meet your requirements.

History

Alerton was founded in 1981 by Al Lucas, Clair Jenkins, and Tony Fassbind in Bellevue, Wa. The company’s name was derived from the initials of these three entrepreneurs. Lucas, who was Jenkins’ father-in-law, was president after his retirement. Fassbind was the chief executive officer and technologist, while Jenkins took on the role of lead business developer.

Alerton entered the building automation systems market by incorporating direct digital controls into its products. Major players in the market only widely recognized this technology during the early 1980s. The company developed its control protocol called Ibex and later transitioned to using the license-free BACnet protocol in 1995. Alerton was the first in the controls industry to implement this protocol across its entire product line.

In 2003, the UK building supplies company Novar acquired Alerton. As a result of the acquisition, “Alerton Technologies” became a wholly owned subsidiary of Novar Controls and part of Novar’s Intelligent Building Systems division. The acquisition was seen as a growth opportunity for both companies, with Novar recognizing Alerton as a pioneer in developing the BACnet protocol.

In 2005, Honeywell acquired Novar, making Alerton a part of Honeywell. Within Honeywell, Alerton is now part of the Automation and Controls group.

Products

Ascent Control Module

Alerton Controls offers many products designed to build automation control systems. One standout product is the Alerton Ascent Control Module (ACM), the HVAC operations’ central control and monitoring system.

The ACM ensures efficient energy management and optimal performance using an intuitive interface and advanced algorithms. In addition to the ACM, Alerton Controls offers a variety of peripheral devices that seamlessly integrate with their building management system.

These devices, including temperature sensors, pressure transducers, damper actuators, and airflow sensors, are all designed for precise measurements and smooth operation within BACnet systems.

Compass

Compass: This innovative system offers customizable navigation, data visualization, and interactive interfaces for efficient monitoring, control, and management of facility systems.

Identify and resolve internal environmental issues, improve efficiencies, and simplify scheduling and occupancy management. The intuitive interface displays operating statuses and alerts, while the system accommodates up to 3000 controllers and supports up to 256 users.

With features like the Alarm and Trendlog Builder, EASE Scheduling, Summary Pages, and OmniGraphics, Compass 2 sets a new standard for performance and productivity. Upgrade seamlessly and enjoy faster BACnet™ data availability, improved data display performance, and comprehensive building monitoring and optimization with the Ascent Control Module. Discover the power and scalability of Compass 2 for managing large and complex facilities.

VIP Controllers

The Alerton VisualLogic IP Controller (VIP) – for efficient building control is equipped with advanced features and cutting-edge technology; the VIP controller is designed to enhance system operations and ensure optimal performance.

Choose from two models – the VIP-363-HOA and VIP-363-VAV. The VIP-363-HOA is perfect for control and process equipment, while the VIP-363-VAV is designed explicitly for precise airflow control in critical environments.

VIP controllers have a real-time clock, 16-bit universal inputs and outputs, and a powerful 32-bit processor.

VIP controllers include Hand-Off-Auto (HOA) switches for outputs and can also function as stand-alone controllers with their own real-time clock.

Controllers integrate with BACnet systems and support high-speed communication across BACnet/Ethernet, BACnet/IPv4, BACnet/IPv6 networks, and Network Time Protocol (NTPv4).

These controllers offer excellent connectivity options, featuring a 4-port switch supporting various network topologies and Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol (RSTP).

Alerton VIP controllers include Alerton Microtouch and BACtalk Microset, Microset II, and Microset 4 wall sensors. These sensors provide data display, setpoint adjustment, and equipment setup access for ultimate control.

With programming capabilities using Alerton’s graphical programming language, VisualLogic, our VIP controllers can handle complex calculations for demanding building system operations.

Automation features such as schedules, trend logs, alarms, and zones (optimum start) make operating your building systems easy and efficient.

Stay connected with Alerton VIP controllers through Ethernet support, EIA-485 (RS-485) communication, and protocols like BACnet/Ethernet, BACnet/IPv4, BACnet/IPv6, and Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol (RSTP).

Programming is made simple and efficient with Alerton’s VisualLogic toolset.

Alerton’s VIP CONTROLLERS ARE BUILT TO MEET THE HIGHEST QUALITY AND SAFETY STANDARDS with UL listing and compliance with BACnet, UL, EMC, RoHS, FCC, and IC standards. Invest in the Alerton VisualLogic IP Controller and take your building control to the next level.

Envision

Another impressive offering from Alerton Controls is their Envision for BACtalk software. This powerful software is a central hub for managing multiple buildings within an integrated system. Facility managers can monitor energy consumption in real-time and access HVAC controls remotely while gaining valuable insights through detailed analytics.

VisualLogic Controllers

VisualLogic® BACnet/MSTP Controllers,” including the VLC-E and VAV-E product lines, are advanced controllers designed for building control systems. These controllers are BACnet-compliant and are tailored for diverse applications in modern buildings, such as air handling units and terminal devices. They offer programmable control logic, future software update capabilities, a 32-bit processor, and a quick processing time of 100 msec for Direct Digital Control (DDC) programs. Additionally, they are certified by BACnet Conformance, UL, and FCC and are designed to be backward compatible with older models.

On the other hand, Alerton’s BACtalk VLCs are also high-performance controllers optimized for controlling central plant systems, air handling units, terminal units, and various other equipment. These BACnet-compliant controllers integrate smoothly with BACnet systems without the need for proprietary components. The VLC-550 model, for instance, offers five binary, ½ amp triac outputs and has all inputs at a 10-bit resolution.

Visual Logic Display

Lastly, Alerton Controls’ VisualLogic Display (VLD) series provides sleek touch-screen interfaces for easy access to essential building management functions. From adjusting temperatures to scheduling modifications and receiving alarm notifications, users can effortlessly navigate the intuitive interface. The VLD series also offers customizable graphics, making it simple to visualize complex data on energy consumption and system performance.

Overall, Alerton Controls has excelled in providing a comprehensive range of products that meet the demands of modern building automation control systems.

Seamlessly integrating with BACnet systems, Alerton Controls provides a wide range of user-friendly products. Customers rave about the easy-to-use interface of the building management system, enabling effortless control and monitoring of various building aspects. All components work in perfect harmony, ensuring optimal efficiency and comfort.

One standout feature is Alerton Controls’ focus on energy management. With precise monitoring and adjustment capabilities, their HVAC controls enhance energy efficiency, leading to cost savings and reduced environmental impact. Users consistently praise the reliability and durability of Alerton Controls’ products, ensuring long-term performance without frequent maintenance or breakdowns.

Regarding building automation controls systems, Alerton Controls is a good choice. Boasting an extensive range of solutions and a proven track record, they are the top provider for commercial and industrial building owners and managers seeking enhanced control over their HVAC systems and energy consumption.

With Alerton Controls, your building will be equipped with state-of-the-art technology that optimizes comfort and minimizes costs. Alerton is a solid choice as a building automation controls system in 2023.
